tool.name: gnutls-cli-debug
tool.title: GnuTLS debug client
tool.description: Simple client program to check TLS server capabilities.
tool.detail:
TLS debug client. It sets up multiple TLS connections to 
a server and queries its capabilities. It was created to assist in debugging 
GnuTLS, but it might be useful to extract a TLS server's capabilities.
It connects to a TLS server, performs tests and print the server's 
capabilities. If called with the `-V' parameter more checks will be performed.
Can be used to check for servers with special needs or bugs.
tool.short-usage:
Usage: gnutls-cli-debug [options] hostname
gnutls-cli --help for usage instructions.

options.description: The application protocol to be used to obtain the server's certificate (https, ftp, smtp, imap, ldap, xmpp, lmtp, pop3, nntp, sieve, postgres)
options.detail: Specify the application layer protocol for STARTTLS. If the protocol is supported, gnutls-cli will proceed to the TLS negotiation.
